alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Logan; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Union OH. In West Central Ohio, Champaign and Logan. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Marysville, Plain City, North Lewisburg, New California, Milford Center, Woodstock, Unionville Center, Pottersburg, Raymond, Broadway, State Route 4 at State Route 161, Chuckery, New Dover, Middleburg, East Liberty and US Route 33 at US Route 42.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
